item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated (84 封私信 / 80 条消息) 说话如何改掉“嗯”“那个”“就是”之类的连接词？ - 知乎 in the user temberature at 2022-05-22T13:16:37

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 将想法送入你的轨道（Orbit） in the user temberature at 2022-06-05T04:54:57
item.description:
in reference to:

时间间隔随着成功/失败而呈指数级扩大/缩小 卡片写作：重复问题、模糊的想法、主干想法，从中积累思考，时间跨度为几个月

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 将想法送入你的轨道（Orbit） in the user temberature at 2022-06-05T04:55:08
item.description:
in reference to:

比如说「我现在读够什么了」，这东西就会几天之内再次呈现；

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 将想法送入你的轨道（Orbit） in the user temberature at 2022-06-05T04:55:39
item.description:
in reference to:

说某个东西「不是现在读」，那就几个月，之后是几个月之后再呈现…… 电子邮件收件箱、任务队列、个人通信等 我这些想象的核心，是每日都要练习的一种习惯，类似冥想：打开软件，完成软件呈上的微任务。

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 将想法送入你的轨道（Orbit） in the user temberature at 2022-06-05T05:01:24
item.description:
in reference to:

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 将想法送入你的轨道（Orbit） in the user temberature at 2022-06-05T05:02:44
item.description:
in reference to:

你的 PDF 和电子书阅读器中的标注，可以自然地这个中心化的 SRS 中找到，而不是封存在某个无法访问的侧边栏中。现代操作系统，会根据聊天消息或电子邮件，尝试创建日历事件或建立联系人。类似地，SRS 系统也可能根据你标为书签的链接，或重复搜索的短语，来尝试创建 SRS 卡片。

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated MasterHowToLearn - Why 99% People Never Learned How To Learn And How to Become That 1% (I) in the user temberature at 2022-08-08T11:34:26
item.description:
in reference to:

Linking makes the thinking process tangible: links are the proofs that you’ve connected the material with your prior knowledge. Having a lot of unlinked notes is also proof that different pieces of information exist in isolation.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated MasterHowToLearn - Why 99% People Never Learned How To Learn And How to Become That 1% (I) in the user temberature at 2022-08-08T11:35:57
item.description:
in reference to:

But here’s the catch: the connection doesn’t happen automatically. You still have to intentionally and consciously think about the big picture to improve your understanding.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated r/vim - Has anyone ever felt like the cognitive load of using motions balances out any benefits? in the user temberature at 2022-08-13T02:34:35
item.description:
in reference to:

You are still using your head. At some point most of the things that are vim related won't be processed by your brain but by your muscle memory.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated r/vim - Has anyone ever felt like the cognitive load of using motions balances out any benefits? in the user temberature at 2022-08-13T02:35:35
item.description:
in reference to:

Over time you will figure out your preferred motions and work flow. You will develop muscle memory for most of it and it will be intuitive (直观) and instinctive (本能) .

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated r/vim - Has anyone ever felt like the cognitive load of using motions balances out any benefits? in the user temberature at 2022-08-13T02:44:45
item.description:
in reference to:

Learning to use vim really is like learning a language. You're still "translating" in your head instead of just "speaking" naturally. Just keep practicing and it will become second nature with time.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated What is your most productive shortcut with Vim? in the user temberature at 2022-08-13T02:53:34
item.description:
in reference to:

vi has 26 "marks" and 26 "registers." A mark is set to any cursor location using the m command.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated What is your most productive shortcut with Vim? in the user temberature at 2022-08-13T02:58:17
item.description:
in reference to:

(I don't recall ever having interactively used more than four marks in 15 years of using vi; one creates one's own conventions regarding how marks and registers are used by macros that don't disturb one's interactive context).

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated ripgrep/GUIDE.md at master · BurntSushi/ripgrep in the user temberature at 2022-08-25T11:59:49
item.description:
in reference to:

Instead of writing out the glob every time, you can use ripgrep's support for file types:

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated ripgrep/GUIDE.md at master · BurntSushi/ripgrep in the user temberature at 2022-08-25T12:01:10
item.description:
in reference to:

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated ripgrep/GUIDE.md at master · BurntSushi/ripgrep in the user temberature at 2022-08-25T12:02:55
item.description:
in reference to:

Alternatively, you can combine the --only-matching (or -o for short) with the --replace flag to achieve the same result:

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated ripgrep/GUIDE.md at master · BurntSushi/ripgrep in the user temberature at 2022-08-25T12:05:43
item.description:
in reference to:

ripgrep will never modify your files. The --replace flag only controls ripgrep's output. (And there is no flag to let you do a replacement in a file.)

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated ripgrep/GUIDE.md at master · BurntSushi/ripgrep in the user temberature at 2022-08-25T12:22:54
item.description:
in reference to:

If you wind up needing to search a lot of PDFs, then ripgrep's parallelism can make the speed difference even greater.

为了安全起见，我用了iCloud，坚果云和我自己NAS的WebDAV服务器进行备份。之前也用了Dropbox，可无奈免费版的2G空间实在是不够用。

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 从 Evernote 到 DEVONthink - 少数派 in the user temberature at 2022-08-30T10:30:48
item.description:
in reference to:

DEVONthink 在学术领域有着非常广阔的前景，不止可以用作 Archive 工具，也是是非常好的 research 工具。从学生的角度来看，将从 Portal 中下载下来的 PPT、PDF 等文件 Index 到 DEVONthink 中，使用 RTFD 记笔记，随后使用 See Also 从之前 Index 好的数据中检索相关信息；另外使用 DEVONthink Index Bookends 的 attachment folder，从而使用 Bookends 管理 citation、DEVONthink 做 research，都是非常吸引人的使用场景。这篇文章的 research 工作全部是在 DEVONthink 中完成的，当所有相关文件全部存入 DEVONthink 以后，搜索真是一件美好的事情。另外能够检索 Google Scholar 等数据库的 DEVONagent是无缝整合进 DEVONthink 中的，在只使用 DEVONthink 就获得了令我满意的体验情况下，我十分期待把 DEVONagent 融入工作流以后的表现。

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 金融消费者如何购买 in the user temberature at 2022-08-30T15:08:35
item.description:
in reference to:

、合同条款复杂、坑多，金融机构抱怨消费者预期高、拒绝承担风险、不理智。究其原因在于，消费者自身和金融机构对于消费者的金融行为都没有认知和把握。 本书全面梳理了消费者金融行为这个重要但“冷门”的主题，话题涉及常见的金融行为，包括投资、保险、借款、储蓄、资金管理、缴税和规避欺诈，综合了各个主题最前沿的研究，并且以案例结合观点展开阐述。 本书讨论了人们金融行为的决定因素和条件，如个体差异和个性、对风险得失的理解、自信、信任、风险偏好、时间偏好、决策制定和自我调控等等，分析了针对不同的金融消费行为，这些因素是如何地影响着

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated At What Age Does Our Ability to Learn a New Language Like a Native Speaker Disappear? in the user temberature at 2022-09-02T03:03:33
item.description:
in reference to:

In what could be the most surprising conclusion, the researchers say that even among native speakers it takes 30 years to fully master a language. The study showed a slight improvement—roughly one percentage point—in people who have been speaking English for 30 versus 20 years. The finding is consistent for both native and non-native speakers.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated How long does it take to master a language like a native speaker? in the user temberature at 2022-09-02T03:10:21
item.description:
in reference to:

I find that memorizing a number of ‘filler’ words or sentences can greatly increase your ability to come off as native, as well as knowing some expressions and sayings. Instead of expressing agreement with a simple ‘yes’ you could try responding with “you know what? I Agree!” or “I think I see what you mean”. It’s agreement either way but it sounds a lot more ‘native’.

To use this feature, simply drag your existing PDFs into your Zotero library or use the “Store Copy of File” or “Link to File” options from the add new item menu (green plus sign). (You can disable these automatic functions in the General pane of Zotero preferences.)

in reference to:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 编写第一个Qt程序 in the user temberature at 2022-12-12T16:39:57
item.description:
in reference to:

在 Build 设置界面上，有一个“Shadow build” 复选框。如果勾选此项，编译后将在项目的同级目录下建立一个编译后的文件目录，目录名称包含编译器信息，这种方式一般用于使用不同编译器创建不同版本的可执行文件。如果不勾选此项，编译后将在项目的目录下建立“Debug”和“Release”子目录用于存放编译后的文件。

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated Google Colaboratory in the user temberature at 2022-12-13T12:52:23
item.description:
in reference to:

This method answers queries in two steps: first it retrieves the information relevant to the query, then it writes an answer tailored to the question based on the retrieved information. The first step uses the Embedding API, the second step uses the Completions API.

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated Google Colaboratory in the user temberature at 2022-12-13T12:55:17
item.description:
in reference to:

Sections should be large enough to contain enough information to answer a question; but small enough to fit one or several into the GPT-3 prompt. We find that approximately a paragraph of text is usually a good length, but you should experiment for your particular use case.

item.description:
in reference to:

By default, in public repositories, any user can submit reviews that approve or request changes to a pull request. Organization owners and repository admins can limit who is able to give approving pull request reviews or request changes.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated OpenAI API in the user temberature at 2022-12-13T16:00:10
item.description:
in reference to:

There are two ways to limit the likelihood of the API making up an answer.Provide a ground truth for the API. If you provide the API with a body of text to answer questions about (like a Wikipedia entry) it will be less likely to confabulate a response.Use a low probability and show the API how to say "I don't know". If the API understands that in cases where it's less certain about a response that saying "I don't know" or some variation is appropriate, it will be less inclined to make up answers.
